parallel.distributed

Class DRWLock

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.distributed.DRWLock

  • public class DRWLock
extends java.lang.Object
    class implements a distributed read-write lock object across many threads living in many (remote) JVMs. The following constraint is imposed on DRWLock objects use: each of its methods can only be called from the same thread that created this DRWLock object (otherwise an exception is thrown). As a consequence, every thread that wishes to obtain a read/write lock, must create such an object, and then start invoking its methods.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2014

    Company:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DRWLock()
      no-arg constructor assumes the following defaults: host="localhost" port=7897 rwlock/coord name = "DRWLock_localhost_7897"
      DRWLock(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String coordname)
      constructor specifies the IP address specified by first two argument parameters with the name specified in the third parameter, so that later invocations of the methods of this object will synchronize the current thread with all other threads in all JVMs having constructed RWLock objects connected to the same server-port, and same rwlock name.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void done()
      invoke this method when the thread has no further use for this r/w lock.
      void getReadAccess()
      obtain a global read-lock corresponding to the coordinator name specified in the constructor of this object.
      void getWriteAccess()
      obtain a global write-lock corresponding to the coordinator name specified in the constructor of this object.
      void releaseReadAccess()
      release the read-lock held by this thread.
      void releaseWriteAccess()
      release the read-lock held by this thread.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • DRWLock

    public DRWLock(java.lang.String host,
       int port,
       java.lang.String coordname)
        throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
               java.io.IOException,
               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
               ParallelException
    constructor specifies the IP address specified by first two argument parameters with the name specified in the third parameter, so that later invocations of the methods of this object will synchronize the current thread with all other threads in all JVMs having constructed RWLock objects connected to the same server-port, and same rwlock name.

  • Method Detail

    • getReadAccess

      public void getReadAccess()
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          ParallelException
      obtain a global read-lock corresponding to the coordinator name specified in the constructor of this object.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the server JVM is not in synch with this JVM's classes.
      ParallelException - if this DBarrier object was constructed by a different thread than the one calling this method.

    • releaseReadAccess

      public void releaseReadAccess()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                              ParallelException
      release the read-lock held by this thread.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      ParallelException - if calling thread is not the same as creation thread.

    • getWriteAccess

      public void getWriteAccess()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                           ParallelException
      obtain a global write-lock corresponding to the coordinator name specified in the constructor of this object.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a network error occurs
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the server JVM is not in synch with this JVM's classes.
      ParallelException - if this DBarrier object was constructed by a different thread than the one calling this method.

    • releaseWriteAccess

      public void releaseWriteAccess()
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                               ParallelException
      release the read-lock held by this thread.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      ParallelException - if calling thread is not the same as creation thread.

    • done

      public void done()
          throws ParallelException,
                 java.io.IOException
      invoke this method when the thread has no further use for this r/w lock. It is the user's responsibility to ensure the thread does not hold neither a read nor a write lock on this object. If the method is invoked while a lock is still held, then the lock will never be released again.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      ParallelException
